document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Gong, Lu, Tsaur, Shun-Chern, Zhu, Lin, An, Keying & Chen, Hongwei
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the subgenus Phortica (sensu stricto) (Diptera, Drosophilidae) from East Asia, with assessment of species delimitation using DNA barcodes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the subgenus Phortica (sensu stricto) (Diptera, Drosophilidae) from East Asia, with assessment of species delimitation using DNA barcodes

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Phortica ( Phortica ) glabtabula Chen & Gao in
Chen et al . 2005: 3967
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species is very similar to
P . cardua
Okada, 1977
in the male terminalia ( Figs. 7 C–E, 15C–E), but can be distinguished from the latter by having the posterior bands of male abdominal third to fifth tergites nearly not connect to lateral margins ( Fig. 5H ); male arista with 2 or 3 ventral branches medially, the longest ventral branch longer than 1/2 the longest dorsal branch ( Fig. 15A ); male abdominal sixth tergite laterally narrower than in
P . cardua
( Figs. 7B , 15B ).

Specimens examined.

820–890m
, 22.ix.2003 , H.W. Chen;
